programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.sub-title: Northern Spain and the Camino de Santiago
programme.desc: In Northern Spain, we'll run with the bulls in Pamplona and join the pilgrims on the Camino de Santiago.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: Zipping from Haarlem to Rotterdam, and from Delft to the former Zuiderzee, we'll enjoy fragrant cheese markets, soggy polderland, charming towns, and windmills both new and old.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: In this first of three shows focusing on European travel skills, we'll visit the Netherlands and Germany to learn about transportation by train and car, changing money, and settling in upon arrival.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: Rick Steves: In this second of three shows focusing on travel skills, we'll visit Venice, Siena, and the Cinque Terre in Italy to learn about trip planning, packing, safety, and — perhaps the most rewarding skill of all — connecting with the locals.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: We'll climb a mountain aboard a steam train, learn some Welsh and herd sheep.

programme.title: Rick Steves' Europe
programme.desc: We'll dine at the fisherman's harbor in Cefalù, ponder the ancient Greeks in Siracusa, commune with monks in a Capuchin crypt, and eat our way through a classic Sicilian banquet.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: In Mexico, Rick shows you this big bowl of comfort tortilla soup at a downtown diner, and at a historically luxe Inn. At his Chicago home kitchen, Rick uses his kitchen's pressure cooker to make two nurturing soups.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Who says cocktail parties must be dressy, mood-lit affairs? Rick's menu on this summer Sunday afternoon is all about seafood and ice-cold drinks. His themes are simplicity, fun, and freshness, inspired by Mexican deep-sea fishing trips.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.sub-title: Sustainable Aquaculture in the Rich Waters of Ensenada
programme.desc: Two of Ensenada's best chefs, Benito Molina, and Alain Genchi, join Rick for a lesson in mollusk farming. Juan Carlos Lapuente takes the trio to the rich coastal waters to see oyster and mussel farming and learn why these waters thrive.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: With more than 20 million people, and a dazzlingly rich cultural and culinary history, Mexico City is like its own planet, and these days, it's a younger, hipper planet than ever.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Ricks got nothing against cerveza and margaritas, but Rick wants to explore another side of Mexican drinking: wine. Mexican wine. And no, that is not a misnomer. In fact, the burgeoning craft of Mexican wine is growing in unusual places.

programme.title: Mexico One Plate at a Time with Rick Bayless
programme.desc: Over a breakfast of tortas, Rick and his daughter, Lanie, plan an all-day torta marathon in Mexico City. Their quest begins at the city's charming Sunday flea market, Lagunilla, where they check out some simple, yet mouthwatering tortas.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: Holy Week is among the most important rituals in Christianity. The week before Easter, Holy Week celebrates the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ. In Seville, Spain, from Palm Sunday to Easter Sunday, dozens of processions take place, each one led by one of the 60 brotherhoods in the city.

programme.title: Recreating Eden
programme.desc: Birgit Piskor's garden is a favorite stop for visitors who take part in Victoria, British Columbia's garden tours. In just a few years, Birgit created a flourishing garden surrounding her urban home that has changed her life forever.

programme.title: Recreating Eden
programme.desc: When Susan and Michael found a new home in Tuscany, their initial vision for the land changed in time as the land began to speak to them in ways they had not anticipated. The couple also had a unique effect on their new neighbors, as well.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Board the Empire Builder to Glacier National Park and the Denali Star to Denali National Park, experience the elegance of the American Orient Express, and the restored glory of the Grand Canyon Railway. All aboard for these and other nostalgic journeys through America's national parks.

programme.title: Inside America's National Parks
programme.desc: Experience the supreme and sacred spectacle of the Grand Canyon. This insider's view of one of the world's greatest natural wonders takes you rim-to-rim to hike hidden canyons, plunge into ancient pools, raft world-class rapids, discover manmade gems, and explore extreme backcountry.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: With acres of sea lions and thousands of buffalo, national parks host the largest homes to all kinds of critters. Get close to your favorite animal in this episode of Best Parks Ever.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: Host Rudy Maxa and Washington, D.C. restaurateur and chef Daisuke Utagawa enthusiastically eat their way through Hong Kong, from cheap but authentic, hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurants to Michelin-starred palaces. Along the way they illustrate the excitement and energy that defines Hong Kong.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: From bathing in the neon lights of the Shibuya neighborhood at night, to marveling at the city's spring explosion of cherry blossoms, to learning your fortune by consulting a joss-stick at a Buddhist temple, Tokyo offers a rainbow of experiences guaranteed to fascinate.

programme.title: Rudy Maxa's World
programme.desc: For sheer tropical splendor, the islands of Tahiti and Bora Bora stand alone. Hyper blue lagoons, white-sand beaches, fish of every shape, size, and color, as well as a generous and welcoming people make these islands key destinations for travelers from around the world.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Anthony travels to Tokyo, where he begins in the Tsujiki market and then is introduced to techniques in preparing edomae sushi. He also learns the diets of Sumo wrestlers.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Singapore: New York in Twenty Years
programme.desc: Tony sets out to find the real Singapore, with its multicultural restaurants and food markets. He samples prescription food dishes, explores the Geyland Serai Market, and rides the clean and efficient local subway.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.sub-title: Food Tastes Better with Sand Between Your Toes
programme.desc: In the Caribbean paradise of St. Martin, Tony eats a healthy Rastafarian meal with a freedom fighter, helps prepare grub for a food caravan, discovers foodstuffs not available at American supermarkets, and finally relaxes at a beach bar.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Known as Brazil's capital of happiness, Salvador da Bahia offers fruitful local markets, and rich Bahian cuisine. Here, Tony takes part in a traditional local ceremony, and experiences the culinary talents of the famous Bahian artist of the kitchen - Chef Dada.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: A spontaneous layover in Bangkok, Thailand leads Tony into the city, where he tries dishes of deep-fried frog skins and pla rah, a fish-paste that has fermented anywhere from three months to a year.

programme.title: WaterVoyagers - Chinese Adventures
programme.desc: The team looks at the history, mystery, and scenic beauty of the Yangtze River.

programme.title: Discovering the World
programme.desc: Journey to Namibia, where lunar deserts and fantastic canyons take turns displaying the most beautiful sand dunes in the world, creating a setting that defies the imagination. Bushmen, Himbas, and Heros, with their innate kindness, further accentuate the alluring atmosphere you will find here.

programme.title: Rituals of the World
programme.desc: "First marriage and then love." This Indian proverb describes Indian society quite accurately in terms of how the tradition of marriage is perceived and experienced in the country. In India, people do not just marry whoever they wish. It is the family that decides in an arrangement called Shaadi.

programme.title: Secrets of the National Parks
programme.desc: Hawaii Volcanoes and Haleakala National Parks are two of the most extraordinary places on Earth. Here you can witness molten lava bubbling from the earth, catch a spectacular sunrise above the cloud-line, or take a dip into pools of paradise.

programme.title: National Parks Revealed
programme.desc: Board the Empire Builder to Glacier National Park and the Denali Star to Denali National Park, experience the elegance of the American Orient Express, and the restored glory of the Grand Canyon Railway. All aboard for these and other nostalgic journeys through America's national parks.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: Volcanoes erupt and geysers explode in this sizzling episode. Take a look at the hottest parks you can visit!

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Utrera, Spain contains a strong flamenco heritage, as is evident at the lively Potaje Gitano Festival. Mickela then meets a six-year-old flamenco dancer named Carmen, sits with singer Tomas De Perrate, and becomes an honorary Bell Ringer.

programme.title: Bare Feet with Mickela Mallozzi
programme.desc: Mickela gets a taste of The Balkans as she explores three of New York City's five boroughs: the Slavic Soul Party in Brooklyn, the Gypsy Festival in Manhattan, and the Little Serbia celebration in Queens.

programme.title: Big Little Footprints
programme.desc: We remind viewers just how much you can find when exploring your own backyard.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: The Dodecanese islands represent a fascinating tapestry of customs, foods, landscapes, and history. Diane delves into the common threads and ingredients that characterize the cuisine of this unique island group in three memorable recipes.

programme.title: My Greek Table with Diane Kochilas
programme.desc: Chios is a wealthy, relatively undiscovered, island in the Aegean Sea known for silk, citrus, and a wealth of food lore, including mastiha, an ancient superfood. Diane learns to make pasta from a local cook inspiring her to cook some more.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: Reinventing the cocktail party with live fire.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Cold smoked scallops; smoke-roasted chicken; pecan-smoked baby back ribs.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Get an inside look at the tools and fuels for creative smoked ribs!

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Fire
programme.desc: The melting pot extreme, traditional American BBQ meets ethnic grilling.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: Don't wait for Thanksgiving to try these twists on holiday favorites.

programme.title: Steven Raichlen's Project Smoke
programme.desc: It's surf and turf! Learn to smoke shrimp cocktails, trout, tri-tip and duck.

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain A Cook's Tour
programme.desc: Cambodia: With a friend along for the ride, Tony travels to Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where he explores a food culture that is both pleasing to the palette and slightly frightening.
